comments.body:
it should specifically not truncate it
It should truncate `'\u{1F3F3}\u{FE0F}\u{1F308}X'` to a rainbow flag, dropping only the `'X'`.

OK, but from what I can tell a rainbow flag is four scalar values: `'\u{1F3F3}\u{FE0F}\u{200D}\u{1F308}'`, not just the three.

[Not that it's definitive, but Chrome renders the one with only three scalar values as two separate characters, flag and rainbow.]
OK, spoke with Ian, and we decided that my example is correct: the first two values indicate that we want the "Emoji Flag" (as opposed to just a flag), and it's followed by a rainbow.
not sure what the comment means here

Just following the comments in the rest of the tests: it means it's expecting the text "a1" with the start and end of the current selection to be at the end (represented by the parens).  At least that's how I extrapolated it from the other comments, anyhow.
